alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 11:33AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Douglas and southern Jefferson Counties through 1215 PM MDT... At 1133 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Pine Grove to 6 miles southwest of Cheesman Reservoir, or along a line extending from 33 miles southwest of Denver to 34 miles northwest of Colorado Springs. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Castle Rock, Roxborough Park, Larkspur, Perry Park, Louviers, South Platte, Westcreek, Castle Pines, Buffalo Creek, Devil`s Head, Wellington Lake, Pine Grove, Sedalia, Sprucewood, Cheesman Reservoir, Deckers and Greenland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
